Je ne suis pourtant pas friand de ce genre de jeu ; les clickers, mais celui-ci sort du lot avec quelques qualités qui peuvent sembler anodines pour certains mais qui m'ont alors séduit. Premièrement l'aspect humoristique du jeu et son univers décalé qui pourrait s'avérer être une parodie des anciens beat 'em up arcades des années 80. Mais surtout l'aspect de simplement cliquer ne disparaît pas ce qui paraît logique mais qui est pourtant très rare avec une multitude de clickers offrant des aides et options d'auto-clicks qui rendent les derniers niveaux quasi automatiques.

Son principal défaut est pour ma part qu'il manque de succès, principalement lié aux succès du jeu, pourtant nombreux (+100). Ce qui ne pousse pas tous les joueurs à une réelle fin en matière de réalisation du jeu à 100 %.

Un jeu que je recommande à tous joueurs, particulièrement aux amateurs de clickers qui voudraient passer 10 heures sur ce jeu !

32869760.review:
This is the best clicker games I've ever play, and the good thing is ... this is not that common idle clicker game.

It is similar to beat em up games, but a clicker. You've play as a Chicken Assassins in level based mission. You can upgrade your stats when level up like rpg games. You can equip your weapon, necklace, potion or armor. You can wear wardrobe like clothes, hat or eye glasses that have stats .... and they are ton of them. So, you can customize your chicken assassin look.

There is main mission and bonus mission. You can play bonus mission if requirement get unlocked after finishing some main mission. But after unlocked the mission, there is another requiremet that is item requirement. You can get these item from main mission, and be sure upgrade your backpack inventory to get more items. If you don't have enough space, you can sell the item that you don't need. But, sometimes Black Market guy need that item that you sell before to trade with you. Yeah, there is Black Market guy that want to trade with you for huge cash and exp boost. Be sure rank up your level and became a Chicken Assassins god.

So, with better artwork and good soundtrack this game is flawless as a clicker games. And if you want play a high quality clicker game, this game is for you.

32266068.review:
Just by the title you can get an idea about this game.

Yup, you take a role of badass chicken called McAllister who wants to get back his love Candy from the clutches of "I FOGOT HIS NAME."

Through levels you will encounter various types of enemies. This is what I liked most. The enemies are hilarious and every level will have different enemies with funny names.

Enemies go from Agent 0, Silent Killer, Gate Crasher, Agent Anatak, Super Agent, Project Nimrod, Agent Hyde, Young Rioter, Football Hooligan, Uncle Jarvis, Masked Hooligan, Angry Feminist, Internet Troll, Elite Officer, Riot Police, Sniper Officer, Allegedly Gator, Mystery, etc.

You will get new weapons, outfits and upgrades as you progress.

In order to get upgrades you need souls which are some sort of game currency.

Souls can be gathered through levels. But most souls can be gathered from soul pot (or whatever it is called).

To gather souls from pot you will need to do much clicking on pot so that it throws out souls. I sugest using Free Mouse Auto Clicker.

Before starting game just start Free Mouse Auto Clicker and set it to Click point (click where mouse is pointed) and Click Interval to for example 5 on 1/100 S option.

Then start game. When in-game point mouse on souls pot and click ctrl + F2 to start Free Mouse Auto Clicker program.

When you want to stop just click ctrl + F3. You can repeat that several times as much as you want and let program gather souls while you eat, go to bathroom, scroll through Facebook, jerk or do something else.

Overall it is good game but sooooo much clicking. My right hand last hurt me so much when I got into puberty.

Oh yes, I remembered - Dr. Spritzel is the main boss.

【ゲーム内実績＆steam実績全解除まで約８時間】
ニワトリが出て殴るゲーム
内容はシンプルなクリッカーだが、敵の反撃があるので
シンプルなアクションRPGのような感覚で気軽に遊べる

ゲームの世界観は映画のパロディ的なシチュエーションをドンドン渡り歩いて行く感じ
だが、その映画世界がエセ日本というか忍殺アトモスフィアに半分汚染されているので、
そこを楽しめるかどうかで購入の判断が別れるかも

ゲーム内容について、敵の火力が適正レベルだとそれなりに高く、育成をしないとあっさり負ける
ペナルティは無いので、再挑戦を繰り返してソウル（お金）や経験値を稼ぎ、攻略したら次のステージへという流れになる

その反復を苦と思うならおすすめしない...というかクリッカー自体そもそも反復を楽しむゲームである

ただ、その反復も衣装集め、レア装備集めやちょっとしたレイドイベントでかなり飽きが来づらいようになっている

全編英語だが、ステータスの数字ATK、DEF等がわかれば遊ぶ上で支障はほぼない。

放置要素が少ないクリッカーが遊びたい、ちょっと気分転換したい　そんな方にオススメ

ただし、マウスは自動化するなり、連射しやすいものを選びましょう
クリアまでにおそらく４－５万回以上クリックすることになるので....

32138890.review:
Fun little clicker game. Stand in the middle, enemies come from both sides, move the mouse over an enemy, click to reduce their health bar to nothing. Rinse and repeat. A lot of loot (with a non-sortable inventory) and a highly customizable loadout. You’ll need to play the levels several times before having good enough gear to beat all the waves. A lot of attempted humor; no cause or lifestyle is sacred, so be prepared. I occasionally had difficulty tracking my mouse cursor; visually, there is a lot happening in each level. Overall, a unique warped charm that is best consumed in small portions; try too much at once, and you might find yourself jaded by repetitious gameplay (or cursed with carpal tunnel syndrome from so much clicking).

Total size on my hard drive: 1.4GB

Also, there is an achievement for leaving a review, so there’s that...

I'd actually been playing for quite a while before I realized that a lot of the content had racist and sexist caricatures and themes. Examples: female protester enemies labelled as "feminist" are fat and ugly; enemies that are similar in appearance to Latino gangbangers are called 'Vato" and "Wetbacks"; African-American (or, simply black) characters are big-lipped and often seen eating fried chicken or dancing around like racist depictions of Aboriginals or wildmen; and, while slim and pretty mermaid enemies are "Hot Mermaids", the fatter, uglier ones are labelled "Feminist Mermaids", with the especially ugly ones titled "Crazy Chick" (the only difference between a "Feminist Mermaid" and a "Crazy Chick" is that the "Crazy Chick" looks mad). The racist caricatures only get worse as the game goes on, and I'm starting to hate playing it. I know I've played it for far too long, but it took a while for things to go from "rare speck of racism" to "this is becoming a pattern" racism. I'm a feminist, female and African-American. This game used to be fun, but now it offends me. I'm not entirely sure why it was Greenlit.

Another issue is the grammar and spelling errors littered in the story sections that appear when you first enter a new area; I feel that, however, I can partially forgive this since the creator(s) seem to not speak English as a first language (this might also explain the values dissonance with the racist caricatures; I'm aware that subtle, satirical racism is still prevalent in other countries' major media like cartoons, so the multitude of jarring blackface characters and unattractive feminist characters might just be normal to them... Doesn't make it okay, though). 

This is actually one of the few times when I've hated auto-save. The game gives you no idea what your current limit for currency is, so when you collect an in-game achievement reward of more currency and hit the limit, you lost whatever was the excess, and with the auto-save, that means having to accept that you cashed in a 1-million soul (currency) reward but only had enough room for 13 more (or, in my case, I had room for 600,000 when I accidenatlly cashed in a 3-million soul reward. The game auto-saved IMMEDIATELY. That amount would've helped a lot in the late game... if I still felt like playing it). 

All-in-all, if it weren't for the racism and sexism, I would've completed this game and had a mostly positive review squared away for it. As it is, I no longer want to touch this odd and (still barring the sexism and racism) quirky, entirely too playable game. It's a shame that I can't recommed it as it is.

29411871.review:
In this exciting click'em-up (or as most people know, a CLUMP), Chicken Assassin follows a cliche love story with a Mobster's floozie. The artwork is great and easy to play. All you need to do is click on the body model of the enemy you need to click to death. Your stats can be upgraded and are very linear. All in all, a fun 6-8 hours on average to beat.

The real problems with the game are the Exchange Shop, Costume Bonuses and Inventory Management. The Exchange Shop occurs every few minutes and requires a random item collected from monsters in certain zones. It's a problem you will never have enough inventory room to utilise it often and it doesn't give enough of a reward. Waste of time.

Items cannot be organized and can be a hassle to spot your best items. Costume Bonuses show up as they are unlocked and the game doesn't tell you how to unlock them. Once again it makes it harder to spot your best costume, let alone  use a specific theme you want to use.

클리커 게임으로 crusaders of the lost idols와 clicker heroes를 오래해보고 다른 클리커 게임도 건드려보는 수준으로 해봤다.

클리커 게임은 초중반엔 사용자가 온전히 게임에 집중해서 이용하지만, 게임이 중후반이 되면 주인손을 떠나 방치형이 되곤한다.

이 게임은 방치형으로 진행하는 게임이 아니다. 그리고 다음 단계로 넘어가기 위해(강해지기 위해) 많은 노가다가 동반되지도 않는다. 

그래서 재밌게 할 수 있으며 반나절이면 스토리를 포함한 스팀업적은 모두 달성할 수 있다.(게임속의 업적이나 커스텀을 모두 달성하려면 추가로 시간이 걸림)

클릭같은 경우에야 사용자의 손목보호를 위해 자동으로 하는 프로그램을 쓰는사람이 있을지 모르겠다.

하지만 약 4만번의 클릭으로 게임의 스토리는 끝난다.(게임내에 4만번클릭 업적이 깨질즈음 마지막 스테이지 클리어)

오랜만에 광클을 하면서 게임을 했다.

다만 게임중간 커스텀모자 하나에 욱일승천기 패턴이 나와서 기분이 찝찝했다.

28617945.review:
Nein, ich schreibe dieses Review nicht weil sie Teil des 100% Games ist, denn, auch wenn es vom Spiel "verlangt" wird, so muss man dies nicht tun, ein Klick auf den "Leave A Review" Button unter Settings reicht, sondern ich möchte eine ernste Review schreiben weil das Spiel unerwartet großartig ist! Ich habe es angefangen in Form einer kleinen Challenge unter meiner Freundin und wollte es eigentlich nur ein paar Minuten spielen, aber was daraus geworden ist, ist die Tatsache das es sich zu einem der besten kurzweiligen Klicker-Spielen entwickelt hat die ich jemals gespielt habe. 

Man spielt ein Huhn das sich durch verschiedene Stages kämpft und das in Form von Klicks. Später gibt es natürlich noch weitere Gadgets, aber ich möchte an dieser Stelle nicht spoilern. Exp sammelt man durch Seelen Kugeln, welche man zum einen durch das Töten von Gegnern erhält oder durch Warten im Menü. 

Ich möchte euch wirklich nicht zuviel verraten, denn was mitunter am meisten beeindruckt hat, war die Tatsache das es richtig viel zu bieten gab. Vom Inventory, über Skills, bis zu verschiedenen Mechaniken. Ich hatte sehr viel Spaß daran. Spielzeit (für 100%) beträgt ca. 4-5 Stunden. Jeden Klick habe ich selbst getätigt (wer was anderes nutzt is eh völlig vorbei am Leben) und habe nichts bereut. 

Wer ein kurzweiliges Spiel sucht und gerne Klicker-Spiele spielt, der wird mich Chicken Assassin sehr glücklich werden. Versprochen. 

Und damit Hallo 2000 Errungenschaft und Hallo 11 Perfektes Spiel :)

28213226.review:
Chicken Assassin Master Of Humiliation is a clicker game that hides behind trying to be so much more than that.

The game play at heart is a that of a clicker game, as Mean McCallister you go wave after wave through enemies as they come from both sides and all you can do is click either side at your fastest rate to kill everyone. If you can make it to the end you get a boss battle the move on to the next stage. Defeating enemies will allow you to collect souls for upgrading, costumes that boost your stats, or items to aid you in battle. There is a deep difficulty curve to it and to progress through the game does require way too much grinding to level yourself up. You'll quickly find yourself in a cycle of playing the same level, dying, selling the useless items you have, upgrading, then doing it all over again and again.

Now after a level you can upgrade your character with what you were given during the level or by repeating tapping an item that is in the middle of the screen. You can upgrade your resources section which gives you more chances to collect souls and increases their value while your other section gives your character more health, damage and the usual stuff such as that. I will say that I am not a fan of your soul counter having a cap on it to where once you hit your limit your leftover souls are lost forever especially because there is no indication of how many souls you can have at one time.

The visuals are oddly impressing with a slick oil painting look to them. Musically however the random assortment of sounds and background music made me almost right away mute the game as it quickly became unbearable to want to listen to. I will say this as well that the game boasts many mature jokes and themes that could come across as racist and sexist so players beware.

Overall Chicken Master is less than stellar. For it's $2 asking price you can squeeze 2-3 hours from it but anything more will quickly become too repetitive. With it's overly grindy nature and not much substance Chicken Assassin is a game that won't cater to the masses and unless this is what your looking for isn't something I'd truly recommend.


Score : 3/10

25616884.review:
Do not play this game. I lost my house, my wife, my dog, my wife's secret lover, and my copy of Overwatch because I spent an entire decade addicted to this!

Real talk: it's probably the best clicker game out there. The environments and enemies are all animated, the soundtrack is very unique (reminiscent of the title screen theme from DMC, one of the few good things about that game), there are multiple weapon types, probably thousands of different weapon and armor pieces, hundreds of outfits, hundreds of enemies with different animations, tons of charm in the story and narration, etc.

Out of the eight hours of gameplay this offers, about forty minutes would be spent clicking the thing that gives you souls (currency) and not battling; at least if you manage upgrades well. If you dislike this, just download autoclicker (it's free) and get through all that farming in five minutes.

This game has tons of charm and detail put into everything. It's badass, atmospheric, and hilarious. It has no microtransactions and sports a story and boss rush mode, along with some semblance of a trade system and shop. All it's missing is perhaps a few more musical tracks and an ending that doesn't suck (spoiler alert). Over-all: 9/10; more than worth the money I didn't have to pay for it (cis white male Youtuber privilege)

25415354.review:
An exquisite game indeed. This is a mix of a clicker game and a beat'em up. What started as a simple clickng on enemies in a fight club fight ended up as a quite incredible pulp adventure mixing cyborgs, mutants, mexican ghosts and killer tomatoes to say the least!

Pros:
- visuals are stunning - game is created in Unity by the way. The level of details is really breathtaking sometimes
- not as tedious as other clickers - really, I wanted to play it and finish the main plot and boss raids, it's really interesting
- loot system is fine and playable
- music is great. I want Chicken Assassin - Master of Humiliation OST, really. Reminds me of when soundtracks were great, like in PSX times, for example in Vigilante 8 games
- humor is great, authors known how to stuff some references to movies or books here and there

Cons:
- cash cap limit - you can upgrade it, but untill you'll upgrade you'll probably lose a lot of souls (cash in game) due to this artificial limit
- how the story ends? - ending is somewhat vague 
- minor optimization bugs - I ran this game on quite a powerful PC but still got minor slows from time to time

Overall - hell yes, just take it and play it. If you are a fan of clicker games then you'll be really satisfied with it. If you're a casual player then the better - this game can provide lots of fun.

Come and join our brave chicken protagonist on his mysterious and pulpy journey!

(If there were some DLCs I would totally buy them)

24833187.review:
Pros:

- Fun.
- Not super grindy.
- Cool graphics.
- Unlock system and the variety in it.
- Achievements add to the playability, give goals and make the progress feel rewarding.

Cons:

- I didn't like how you immediately take damage after enemy gets in range and you have to wait for them to get in that range.
- Most of the progress comes from leveling up in the middle of a mission (level up = full heal) so you can get through it.
- Facebook and Twitter achievements.
- The inventory was a bit too small considering how you get so many different items from the chest and missions.
- Boss raids have a timer and a short window on when you can do them, even though they require so many items to enter.
- In order to 100% the game, you have to replay boss raids and earlier stages a bit too many times.
- Enemies can get stuck in their attack animations so that you can't complete a stage without restarting it.

7.5/10

I am a fan of casual games, and 'clickers' give me a bit of interactivity while watching Netflix that makes stuff interesting for me. That's the context of this commentary.

This game wanted a review in exchange for an achievement, so here it is.

The actual gameplay is ok, it's like a clicker but more active and player dependent rather than passive idling.  If you like clickers then you would probably like the gameplay side of this.

The biggest reason I'm giving this a negative review is that the game is really racist and sexist.  This is one of those games that intentionally tries to be offensive because the developer couldn’t think of any actual jokes.  It features enemies that are just offensive caricature rather than interesting designs.  If they developer just toned down the racism and sexism by making the humans chickens (like the main character) and changing the names of the enemies, then maybe this game would have had some legitimate humor.  The “Angry Feminist” enemy could have just been a “Protester” enemy that was an anthropomorphic chicken holding some sort of anti-fast food sign.  As for the racist elements (such as the Asian man with exaggerated characteristics in the fight club and the many enemies in the Borderland stage with offensive slurs for names), they should have just been removed altogether.  I’m really surprised something like this is even allowed on the steam market.

If the developer’s sense of humor wasn’t so bad, this would actually be an enjoyable game for me, but as it is I can’t stand to play it anymore.  I was going to try to finish the game up despite not liking the humor, but I think I’ll just leave this one as unfinished.

24586310.review:
Somewhat of a weird game, it plays a bit like a side scrolling beat em up, except you can't move. It is also a bit like a clicker game in that you have to keep clicking as fast as possible to kill your enemies before they kill you. There are also RPG elements were you can find equipment and mold your character to fit your preferences and you level up various abilities that make fights easier in various ways.

The control in combat takes a little getting used to - essentially regardless of whether you have a melee weapon or a sniper rifle you always have to wait until the enemy moves into position before you can start damaging them, and even if you are using a melee weapon you can hit them wherever they end up stopping - most come into close range, but there are a few exceptions that hang out nearer the edges of the screen and can be easy to miss if lots of other attackers are closing in.

It has a few flaws like this, but overall it is a fairly interesting and different game.

24365085.review:
Chicken Assassin – Master of Humiliation:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  
McAllister is a chook, but not the usual sort that you greet happily when presented on your plate. No - McAllister is a chicken fighter who has a secret admirer (should we say, lover); the gorgeous Candy! At his last fight, Candy could not resist blowing a flying kiss to this magnificent specimen of a chook!  But therein lies the problem - Dr Pritzel, Candy’s partner, realised at that moment that there was a connection between McAllister and Candy. It is going to be a chook of a fight!

Chicken Assassin – Master of Humiliation is a fighting/clicker game where you play McAllister, the fighting chicken! 
You will start the game at the fight club. The Mean McAllister will position himself in the middle of the screen and start dancing like a true boxer waiting for the first wave of enemies to come by. They will arrive from both directions, left and right. As you knock them out, they will drop souls and some items. These items will automatically be picked up but you will have to hover over the souls to acquire them. You can’t miss them, by the way; they are round and blue. Every ten waves, you will fight a boss until you reach the last one. For example, the fight club has 20 waves which means this level has two bosses to eliminate. As you level up, you will unlock new areas (every 10 levels reached), to fight in and you will have up to 40 waves of enemies to get rid of in the latest stages. You also have boss raids which are like side missions. However, you must have a specific number of items to enter them and they are significantly harder levels. Another point to take into consideration is that each time McAllister reaches another level of experience, his health will be fully regenerated. That could help you the beat a level or a side mission.

With the collected souls, you can upgrade McAllister’s battle expertise: attack, defence, critical hits and more. The resources upgrade is more towards how many souls he can gather, the lucky chest (random items), the black market and other things. 

They are other ways to earn additional souls; you can exchange specific items on the black market or sell them from your inventory. Another way is via the rooster tales. The rooster tales are basically game achievements and you can score big numbers of souls when you achieve some of them.  

Another fun part is the wardrobe where you can customize your favourite chook with hats, uniforms and other accessories. By the way, these item have additional value points which go towards McAllister: attack, defence, critical and health points. The right combination could see you through a level.

Fun 2D graphics. In terms of the soundtrack it is ok but nothing special, in my opinion. I would love to able to change the pointer to something a little bit more obvious. I find it hard to see the mouse pointer from time to time. It could be that I just might need new glasses!

Positives:
~~~~~~~  

-	Good, fun 2D graphics
-	Plenty of enemies and items
-	Fun gameplay
-	Good customization for your favourite chook
-	Achievements and trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 

-	A bit repetitive

7/10

This is a fun clicker/ action game. Jump into the ring and help McAllister rescue the gorgeous Candy.

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

24235935.review:
Upon first glance at Chicken Assassin: Master of Humiliation on Steam, the game seemed like a 2D brawler games involving fowl in fisticuffs. If you read the description of the game, it would have you believe it is an “Epic Action RPG! Full of Sarcastic and Hilarious Characters…”. It is very difficult to tell that it is actually a clicker game, with no mention of this fact in the description or trailers. Let's see how it stacks up.
 
The gameplay of Chicken Assassin is very much as you would expect for a clicker game. As Mean McCallister, Chicken Assassin, you aggressively click-to-death each and every enemy that come storming in from off screen, clearing wave after wave of these baddies until you reach the boss of the level. And once you do reach the boss, you guessed it, you click it into submission. Defeating enemies provides you with items that you can use to give McCallister stat boosts to increase his battle effectiveness, and souls you use to purchase items and upgrades. You also unlock new outfits from time to time through collecting enough of certain item drops or beating certain enemies etc.

The upgrades available to you come in two forms; resource and character. Resource upgrades are focused on increasing the frequency that you obtain souls and the value they possess. This can be something on the level of directly increasing the numeric value per soul or something like purchasing little flame minions to gather souls while you are away (this is one of many portions of the game that seem very mobile gamey). The character upgrades give direct, permanent, stat boosts to Mean McCallister, like increased defense or increase critical chance percentage. You don’t really run into too many spots where you do not have enough souls to get upgrades, due to the “Rooster Tales”, the games achievements that award various amounts of souls as a reward for their completion. That being said, one extremely annoying feature that reeks of mobile game is the “Soul Limit” that you have to spend souls to increase. There were several times were I would earn a 500,000 soul reward only to receive 100,000 and the rest disappear into the ether because “I can’t carry that many souls”. It doesn’t even tell you your current souls limit, so you have no way of knowing if you are close to full or not.
 
After playing for an hour or so, you will quickly realize the pattern of gameplay. Since there is no way to heal outside of an upgrade that gives you a chance to heal after defeating an enemy or leveling up mid-game (instant full health), and the enemies usually get their attack(s) before you can react to them, you will click madly trying to stay alive whilst constantly bleeding health until the boss one-shots you and you have to restart the level. You will keep repeating the cycle of fight, die, re-equip, fight again over and over until you get lucky with the level up timing or are so over leveled you can murder anything in your path and beat the level. But, when you start the next level, it starts all over again, you get your teeth kicked in, so you die, re-equip, fight again etc. It is just the same thing over and over and over, and it gets boring extremely quickly. 

While the sound effects are quite good for the game, the music is another beast all together. Mediocre at its best and irritatingly bad at worst. The main menu music (before you pay souls to unlock more music…in a game you paid for already) is a seemingly random assortment of drum beats and synths, with some weird pitched up vocals meandering around in the background that soon fades to almost out of tune piano chords. Most times you are better off playing with the music turned down. 
 
The worst thing of all however is the blatant racist and sexist imagery the game uses for background characters and enemies. In the very first mission, there is an Asian man with thick round glasses with buck teeth and a rice hat betting on the game, with what looks like a black face caricature eating a fried chicken leg. In the riot scene you fight overweight women with picket signs that read “Free the Nipple”. Their title: “Angry Feminist”. It gets worse when you get to the “Borderlands” level in which you are fighting outside of a gigantic concrete wall where your enemies are “Vatos” and “Wetbacks”. In what way is this okay?!?! It’s astonishing that a game like this was greenlit on Steam, let alone has such high ratings. If these depictions were meant to be in jest (though still in poor taste), it should have been made more clear.
 
Final Opinion
Pros:
1.	Oil Painting ArtStyle is Cool
2.	Visual Effects are Well Done
3.	Lots of Customization Options
Cons:
1.	Grindy
2.	Gets Old Fast
3.	Bad Music
4.	Have to Unlock Features that Should Just Come with A Game You Paid For
5.	RACISM and SEXISM

Buyer beware, I would not recommend it but its your decsion.

RATINGS

Gameplay:	4/10
Graphics:	4/10
Story:		2/10
Sound:		3/10
Content/Cost:	4/10  

OVERALL:	3.4/10

23921392.review:
Chicken Assassin – Master of Humiliation is a clicker game with RPG elements. Firstly, I’d like to mention this game really surprised me, I wasn’t expecting such a good game but it really is an awesome and addicting game.  The first time I started I kept on playing for 32 character levels and I only quit because I had to leave. I am a sucker for clicker games and this is right up my alley. 

[b][u]Graphics:[/u][/b]

The game features nice looking almost borderlands-ish looking art-style and very gorgeous looking color scheme. The game has a “Noir” theme going on. Though it’s 2d but it’s one of the best looking unity game yet for me at least.  It’s nice and dark yet colorful and pleasing to the eyes. The game is locked at 60 FPS and there are no graphics options at all in-game. The options outside the game when you launch are there which is your usual Unity launcher menu with resolution and quality of graphics settings. There were no graphics glitches or errors for me the whole time I played.

[b][u]Sound:[/u][/b]

I am going to have to say this game has an awesome soundtrack. All the levels I played had their own background music which to me really gave me that whole “noir” theme feeling the game is going for. There’s also cheesy sarcastic dialog voice overs when you start a new mission and I found them hilarious. 

[b][u]Gameplay:[/u][/b]

The gameplay is super addictive if you’re a fan of clicker games. Unlike a normal clicker game where you continue and keep clicking in one mode, this game has a story, RPG elements and levels. The game even counts how many times you clicked and that including clicking in menus as well. There's plenty of humor, references and sarcastic stuff in the game. Your main currency is souls which you can earn by killing enemies who then drop these blue souls which you can collect by hovering you mouse over them. You also have a “Soul Pot” I your main menu which you can keep clicking to earn more souls. Later in the game you can get upgrades and one of them is the “Soul Helper” upgrade which spawns a helper who will keep girding for souls. One thing which can be added is an offline farming feature because the can get pretty grind-y in the later levels.

There are quite a few levels and each level features different enemies, bosses, themes, music so there’s plenty of content in this game. When you start the game you’re pretty weak but grinding and upgrading your gear and gaining levels you start to get stronger and stronger. The enemies start coming towards you in waves and you have to click on them to cause damage. A health bar is displayed under each enemy while the bosses have huge health bars. The enemies will attack you and your only way to heal yourself is to have the upgrade ability “Chance to heal when you hit an enemy”. Every 10 waves you get a boss wave. The first few levels have 20 waves which means 2 boss battles and both these bosses are different. The first boss is the normal small boss and you need to kill this boss to unlock next level. The second boss is one of the many giant bosses. The later levels have more waves and bosses so you need to do 20 waves or more to unlock the next levels.

There’s a lot of items in the game, you can earn these items by either playing the game or through a chest that is in your main home screen. Of course to open this chest you need to spend some souls and later in the game you can upgrade the chest level and it’ll start giving higher level stuff. The price will be higher too so you might want to keep that in mind. Items include the levels’ theme stuff for example when you kill Agents enemy-type they will most likely drop ties or when you kill a mouse they will most likely drop cheese. These items can be used to purchase souls from the black market dealer who comes up every now and then and you’ll get a prompt at the bottom of the screen. He randomly wants a different item in different quantities each time and if you have that you can exchange those items for souls and xp. 

There’s also equip-able items. You have 4 slots in which you can equip different items. Firs there’s the weapon slot where you can equip different weapons. Weapons can be a gun or a bat or a broken glass bottle, it doesn’t really make a difference other than stats. Other slot is the armor slot which is pretty self-explanatory. Third slot is the necklace slot and the last slot is the potion/drink slot where you can equip an item and it’ll give you bonus e.g. +2 ATK, +3HP. Other than these items you also have cosmetic items which get unlocked when you do certain things. E.G when you kill 10 constables you’ll unlock the constable hat etc. These costumes also give you boosts. There’s the head slot, the face slot (glasses, masks etc) and the clothes slot. All items effect ATK, DEF, CRIT and HP bonuses. All items have different stats so you can select the gear with HP if you like that playstyle more or you can pick the one with most ATK power.

There’s a lot of upgrades in this game. The upgrades are divided in 2 categories. The battle upgrades and the resources upgrades. Your regular increase HP, Attack, Defense upgrades, critical hit chance upgrade etc. are there, these and a few other ones like an attack bot companion attacks enemies are in the battle upgrades category. The resource upgrades include things like soul farming helpers, more xp earned from enemies, upgrade souls’ value, upgrade treasure chest level etc.

There’s also booster tales which are sort of like achievements/tasks, e.g. kill certain number of enemies to get 200 souls. You can visit the booster tales section and click on collect button to collect these souls. Keep in mind there is a maximum soul limit (this can be upgraded later) so don’t collect higher souls reward then your limit. E.g. if your limit is 10,000 maximum souls, don’t collect 50,000 souls reward. Leave it as is and you can collect it when you upgrade your maximum souls limit. There are no achievements in this game on Steam but I think this system can be used to make Steam achievements which is always a plus for any game.

Later in the game you also unlock boss raid mode. You have to pay a certain amount of a specific item to be able to join these boss raids.

A short gameplay video can be found below:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=713319053

[b][u]Graphics:9/10[/u][/b]
[b][u]Sound:9/10[/u][/b]
[b][u]Gameplay:10/10[/u][/b]
[b][u]Overall:9/10[/u][/b]

[b][u]Conclusion:[/u][/b]

This game is epic, if like me, you’re a clicker fan, this game is a must buy. It’s super addictive and you keep coming back for more and more. Plenty of gear, levels, unlocks will keep you coming back for more and more. The graphics are awesome, soundtrack is very nice as well. There are no achievements or cards at the time of this review and hopefully the developer adds those as it’ll make the game a perfect 10 for me.
